news-item.title: Zicom Electronic Security Systems keeps sliding: down 6.3% in 4 days
news-item.source: Indian Company News Bites - Stock Report
news-item.text:
STOCK REPORT Zicom Electronic Security Systems Limited (NSE:ZICOM), India's 2nd largest electronic components company by market capitalisation, extended its slide Tuesday, shedding an additional Rs1.65 (or 2.9%) to close at Rs56.10. The shares have tumbled Rs3.75 (or 6.3%) over the past four trading days. Compared with the BSE Sensex Index which rose 6.2 points (or 0.03%) in the four days, this represented a relative price change of -6.3%. To download our Detailed Research Report (PDF), giving comprehensive trading and background information on Zicom Electronic Security Systems, please click http://www.buysellsignals.com/001051141660314919 Bearish SignalsSignificant Downtrend- The stock continues its significant downtrend.- The stock dropped on weak volume falling for a fourth consecutive day.- The stock dropped 2.9% on high volatility today.- The stock dropped to a five-month low.- The stock's relative price strength percentile is slipping at 60 for 6 months, 18 for 3 months and 13 for 1 month.- The Moving Average Convergence Divergence (MACD) indicator of 12-day Exponential Moving Average (EMA) of 59.28 minus the 26-day EMA of 61.14 is negative 1.86 suggesting a bearish signal. Both EMA prices are falling, another bearish signal.- The price tumbled 6.6% in the last week and plummeted 12.6% in the last month.- The present value of Rs1,000 (PV1000) invested one year ago in Zicom Electronic Security Systems is Rs744, including a capital loss of Rs271 and dividend reinvested of Rs16. Fundamental measures by comparison with the sector average [in brackets] indicate Overvaluation:- Price to Book of 0.6 [0.5].Other Bearish Signals:- Net profit margin has averaged 5.5% in the last 3 years. This is lower than the sector average of 7.2% and suggests a low margin of safety. Bullish SignalsOversold/Bullish/Support Signals- At Rs56.10 the price is below the lower Bollinger band support of Rs56.16, indicating an upside for it to return to the band. - The Relative Strength Index (RSI) of 24.7 has breached the oversold line of 30, suggesting the price decrease of 11.7% in the last 14 days is unusually high. - The stock is oversold according to the Williams % R indicator of -96.6, suggesting the price is close to its 14-day low of Rs55.80.Fundamental measures by comparison with the sector average [in brackets] indicate Undervaluation:- Price/Earnings of 2.4 [18.2]. - Price/Sales of 0.1 [0.3]. - Return on Equity 5.3% [2.7%].- Year-on-Year Earnings Growth of 78.9% [48.3%].- Return on Assets 3.3% [1.4%].- Return on Capital Employed 13.7% [5.9%].- Dividend yield of 2.1% [0.8%].- Price to EBITDA of 3.3 [4.2].Other Bullish Signals:- Total Liabilities/EBITDA of 3.1 is comfortably below 5, this compares favourably with the Joseph Piotroski benchmark of 5. - The P/E of 2.4 multiplied by the P/NTA of 0.6 is 1.6. Being less than the Benjamin Graham benchmark of 22.5 the stock appears undervalued. - The company is cash rich with Cash to Market Capitalisation at 12.6%. - Tobin's Q Ratio, defined as MCap divided by Total Assets, is 0.4. Compared with the rest of the market the stock is undervalued.- As per the Du Pont analysis, Return on Equity is less than stellar at 5.3%. This is computed as net profit margin of 3.0% times asset turnover [sales/assets] of 1.1 times leverage factor [total assets/shareholders' equity] of 1.6.- Net Profit margin, EBIT margin and EBITDA margin are positive and have seen consecutive rises in recent years.[Year ended, all figures in %]
NoteBeta: the Beta of Zicom Electronic Security Systems stock is 0.3. A Beta lower than 1 suggests this is a low risk, low return stock with volatility less than that of the market. - Zicom Electronic Security Systems is at a discount of 40.1% to its 12-month high of Rs93.65 on 17 Apr, 2013. It is also at a premium of 33.9% to the 12-month low of Rs41.90 on 24 Sep, 2013.
